name: Holiday Inn Express Hull City Centre

reviews.text: I spent just one night here on a business trip. This is one of your "major chain hotels". In another words, safe, standard, bland, boring. Service was ok, breakfast was ok. Only downside was weird alarm system that tried to wake me at 5:30 even though I had not set the alarm at all. I guess it was set by previous occupant but for some reason was not reset automatically.
reviews.title: Safe choice

reviews.text: Easy to find with good parking in centre of town. Checked in by polite girls who explained hotel facilities. Room basic but clean and comfortable with choice of pillows. Heating worked fine and shower had reasonable pressure.
reviews.title: Good stay in we'll located hotel.

reviews.text: Slept soundly and breakfast next morning was good - limited selection but all good quality products.
reviews.title: Don't sleep on the sofa bed

reviews.text: All in all I'd be pleased to stay there again.
reviews.title: No welcome, no wi-Fi, no likely return

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, above the Stephen's Green shopping centre. It's great that the rooms sleep 3 adults...but if, like me you had to share a sofa bed with your daughter it's a nightmare. The sofa bed is not a bed it's like a very thin mattress on wooden planks. It was extremely uncomfortable, so much so we checked out early and went to a Premier Travel Inn because I couldn't stand another night on the sofa bed.
reviews.title: Very convenient for trains and buses

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Should have gone to premier inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + very nearby parking
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.text: + good quality restaurant taking orders late until 9.45
reviews.title: not to good a deal.

reviews.text: + central location in Hull
reviews.title: Best hotel in Hull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + V. Nice modern decor of the building inside and out
reviews.title: Will definitely return! :-)
Does what is says on the tin
reviews.text: The hotel is central and easy to walk to from the railway station. Also close to nearby eating establishments. Room quite well appointed for this high end 'budget' hotel. Bed was ok. Not very comfy but that's mainly my requirements. Was cold in the room and took some time to warm up. Breakfast a big let down. Very limited hot choices. Just scrambled egg and no other egg options. Staff absent at breakfast to offer anything else. For the price it is good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last weekend (2nd/3rd Nov), on arrival we were greeted by a friendly receptionist and were pleased with the standard of the room, it was nice and clean. Unfortunately our room did not have a hairdryer. On the first night (Fri) we arrived home to some noise coming from the room opposite, but this did not continue very long so wasn't too bad. On the Saturday night however we got the worst nights sleep ever due firstly a group of noisy girls arriving home at around 2 am who were rowdy and then woke to a group of noisy, drunken louts who were staying in the room next door. They arrived home about 3 am and for the next 3 hours they swore, had fights and screaming matches, smoked in their room, doors were slamming etc. We rang reception to report this and were told it would be sorted, it wasn't. Even when they eventually quietened down around 5.30 am I couldn't get to sleep as I had been so on edge and kept expecting the noise to start up again. On checking out we reported the incident to the receptionist who was polite but said she didn't have the power to refund us for the Saturday night and gave us the managers details who wasn't in that day. I have emailed the Manager to complain and ask for a refund but as yet have had no reply..... Will not stay here again and would advise anyone staying on a Saturday night to think again if they actually want to sleep!
reviews.title: Stay was ruined by a gang of noisy unruly lads

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on the 27th October 2012 and would recommend to anyone wanting a city centre base at a very reasonable price. The room was modern and clean and the breakfast suited us though the hot water for tea seemed to cause problems galore - but it was busy at breakfast. I will stay again when in Hull.
reviews.title: Good city centre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good clean hotel. booked online, paid there. room was nice an big. Drinks overly priced but were isnt!! downfall was we ordered king bed. its just 2 singles pushed together!!! which is rubbish when wanting to cuddle!
reviews.title: nice clean hotel

reviews.text: Booked using Late rooms , friendly helpful check- in (Saturday 27th at 5.30) . Room was very clean , bathroom immaculate , appeared to be new .
reviews.title: Good cheap accomodation

reviews.text: This holiday inn is very well situated in the town centre near to the bus and train transport links. Only a two minute walk from the town centre and next door to the new st stephens shopping centre.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for one night during September 2012 with a group of friends for my birthday. Alison booked three rooms for me which were all next door to eachother. The rooms are spaceous and well appointed. The hotel was very clean.
reviews.title: In centre of Hull

reviews.text: Over all we received excellent service from all the staff who were more than happy to help.
reviews.title: Horrifying experience

reviews.text: I would definitely recomend this hotel to others and i wouldnt think twice about staying here again. Many thanks for a wonderful stay at Holiday Inn Expres :)
reviews.title: It was fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In centre of Hull. Usual HIE standards which are good value for money. Plenty of parking in multistorey next to hotel but get directions from hotel. Have stayed before and will again. The staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hull City Centre Hotel Kingston-Upon-Hull
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hull City Centre hotel,is ideally located within the city centre, and offers 128 non smoking, air-conditioned bedrooms, each with flat screen colour TV with a variety of channels, FREE WI-FI , hairdryer and tea and coffee making facilities. The Holiday Inn Express Hull City Centre is located next to the Hull train Station and directly linked to the St Stephen's shopping centre. The hotel offers chargeable on-site car parking with direct access to the hotel. All bedrooms, conference rooms and public areas are non smoking. The hotel is in walking distance of the KC Stadium, home of Premiership football club Hull City. The Holiday Inn Express Hull City Centre hotel has a full service bar with two 42inch flat screens, a comfortable dining area which our guest can use, air conditioning and FREE WIFI access throughout the entire hotel. Companies such as Smith & Nephew, Kingston Communications and Reckitt Benckiser and the Hull Royal Infirmary are in the direct vacinity of the hotel. Air conditioned conference facilities are available. FREE WIFI is offered throughout the hotel. Four meeting rooms are available accommodating between 2-55 persons and benefit from natural daylight, air conditioning, Our 'Meet Smart package includes mineral water, tea and coffee, OHP & screen, flip chart and stationary.
